anime.name: Manga Nihon Mukashi Banashi
anime.info: Manga Nihon Mukashi Banashi
Japanese Folklore Tales 2
まんが日本昔ばなし
まんが日本昔ばなし TV 2
supernatural
folklore
AA
A compilation of 10 minute episodes, each based on one of Japan's children's tales such as "Momotaro" or "The Moon Princess". Two 10-minute shorts were presented in each half hour episode.
Half Hour
"Nippon Mukashibanashi" (にっぽん昔ばなし) by Hana-zukin
#1: "Gruppa no Uta" (グルッパーのうた) by Keeper Mates
#2: "Hoshi Sagashi" (ほしさがし) by 相田文三 and Tokyo Shounen Shoujo Gasshoutai
#3: "Jankenpon ~Guu Choki Paa no Uta~" ( ジャンケン ポン ~グー・チョキ・パーのうた~) by ひまわり
#4: "Kaa-san ~Mother~" (かあさん ~マザー~) by ミンツ and 関森れい
#5: "Minna de Tanjoubi" (みんなでたんじょうび) by 中村花子 and Young Fresh
#6: "Ningentte Ii na" (にんげんっていいな) by Yoshimi Nakajima and Young Fresh
#7: "Toppin Karagete Nigerarete" (トッピンからげて逃げられて) by Fujio Tokita
"Ai no Message Part 1" (愛のメッセージ Part 1) by SHOT GUN
"Ai no Message Part 2" (愛のメッセージ Part 2) by SHOT GUN
"Ame to Issho ni" (あめといっしょに) by Mayumi Tanaka
"Boku wa Santa da" (ぼくはサンタだ) by Mayumi Tanaka
"Hayakuchi Song" (早口ソング) by スウィング・キャッツ
"Koi no Bori-san Ogenki Desuka" (こいのぼりさんおげんきですか) by 中村花子 and Young Fresh
"Kono Ko wa Daare" (この子はだあれ) by 森田牧子, 満仲志保 and Young Fresh
"Mori no Soup to Aozora Salad" (もりのスープとあおぞらサラダ) by Mayumi Tanaka
"Run Running Kakekko" (ランランニングかけっこ) by 中嶋安名 and Young Fresh
"Tomodachi ga Ippai" (ともだちがいっぱい) by 林幸生 and Mori no Ki Jidou Gasshou Dan
"Umi wa Ikite Iru" (うみはいきている) by 吉川みずほ
"Yuki wa Osora no Cake-Ya-San" (ゆきはおそらのケーキやさん) by 中村花子 and Young Fresh
